title: 112_s2240
content: Extension of allowance for bonus depreciation for certain business assets. Extension of 100 Percent Bonus Depreciation for certain business assets under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is extended from January 1, 2012, to January 1, 2014. Conforming amendments are made to adjust dates for pre-2013 periods. The amendment extends the 100 percent bonus depreciation for certain business assets from January 1, 2012, to January 1, 2014. The effective date for property placed in service is after December 31, 2011. Additionally, there is an expansion of the election to accelerate AMT credits in lieu of bonus depreciation. The amendment extends 100% bonus depreciation for certain business assets from January 1, 2012, to January 1, 2014, with an effective date for property placed in service after December 31, 2011. There is also an expansion of the election to accelerate AMT credits in lieu of bonus depreciation. The bonus depreciation amount for any taxable year is 20% of the excess of the aggregate depreciation allowed for eligible qualified property placed in service over the depreciation allowed if paragraph (1) applied to all such property. The bonus depreciation amount for any taxable year is limited to 50% of the minimum tax. The bonus depreciation amount is limited to 50% of the minimum tax credit for the first taxable year ending after December 31, 2011. All corporations treated as a single employer under section 52(a) must be aggregated. For bonus depreciation, corporations treated as a single employer under section 52(a) are aggregated and eligible qualified property is defined as qualified property under paragraph (2) with certain date substitutions. The text discusses adjustments to dates for bonus depreciation and the eligibility criteria for qualified property. Adjustments include substituting 'April 1, 2008' for 'January 1, 2008' and specifying the periods for which adjusted basis can be taken into account. In the case of a corporation making an election under subparagraph (A) and which is a partner in a partnership, for purposes of determining such corporation's distributive share of partnership items under section 702, paragraph (1) shall not apply. In certain partnerships, if more than 50% of the capital and profits interests are owned by one corporation, each partner must take into account the applicable depreciation method using the straight-line method. Each partner in certain partnerships must consider their share of partnership amounts for the taxable year, specifically for property placed in service after December 31, 2011. A special rule applies for passenger aircraft regarding written binding contract limitations. The amendment made by this subsection applies to taxable years ending after December 31, 2011.
